Text:
Guests:

Bill O'Reilly, host of The O'Reilly Factor
Ann Coulter, conservative columnist, commentator, and author of Mugged: Racial Demagoguery from the Seventies to Obama
James Pethokoukis, Money & Politics columnist-blogger for the American Enterprise Institute

Hi Guys. I see everyone is excited that Obama got his clock cleaned in the debates. Well, the guy was charged with an impossible task, that is, to defend the indefensible. It is impossible to defend liberalism in the face of reality. Romney had the easy task of repeating facts, and there is no liberal theorem in the world that can deny them. The fact is that Obama's liberalism is not working, just like it has never worked before under different presidents. But our work does not end with the defeat of Obama (of which I am certain.) Our work begins with Romney's victory, because in him I see just another liberal Republican like Bush was. Yes, I will vote for Romney, but let us not fool ourselves. This guy wants to be loved by the media and the democrats. He is not the Marxist that Obama is, but he will implement half of Obama's policies just to appear bipartisan. And that is how our country is going down, one little step at a time.

You're right. Mark Steyn has pointed out that in countries that have gone socialist the 'conservative' candidate almost always promises to more efficiently implement the socialist programs in order to win. That's what's going on with healthcare here. 
 Thanks again! And enjoy the weekend!

Thanks!!

I hope that you occasionally read these comments to know that your efforts and generous sharing is really appreciated!

Keep the faith, and have a great weekend!!

LOL... but you'll vote for him.
Recall the 'anybody but Romney' GOP primaries.  

Know why folks like you will always be full of shit? Because you declare your guy or side is the only ones telling the 'truth'.

Be real dude
